forgeLabs.problem: 78% of health systems run AI projects but only 52% feel operationally ready (Guidehouse/HIMSS Feb 2026). The #1 gap: governance. CIOs have no easy way to track which state/provincial AI laws apply to their deployed models. California AB 489 just kicked in Jan 2026, more coming. Compliance teams are drowning in spreadsheets.
forgeLabs.solution: A lightweight SaaS dashboard that maps your AI inventory against active healthcare AI regulations by jurisdiction. Input your AI tools + locations → get a live compliance status board with alerts when new laws or guidance drop. Think 'Have I Been Pwned' but for healthcare AI compliance.
forgeLabs.moat: LUMEN Scanner's 25+ jurisdiction database + 12 framework monitors = nobody else has this data pipeline built. First-mover on continuous monitoring vs. one-time assessments.
forgeLabs.dataSource: State legislature feeds, FDA guidance RSS, NIST updates, Health Canada directives, provincial privacy commissioners — all public, all underutilized in real-time tooling.
forgeLabs.competitionCheck: No direct competitor doing real-time healthcare AI regulatory tracking as SaaS. OneTrust/Vanta do general privacy — not healthcare AI specific. URAC offers accreditation (consulting), not tooling.
forgeLabs.buildTime: 2-3 nights — leverage existing LUMEN Scanner codebase, add web UI + alerts
forgeLabs.deployTo: Web app (self-service signup), Azure Marketplace, Chrome extension for quick checks
forgeLabs.monetization: Free: 3 AI tools tracked, 1 jurisdiction. Pro $49/mo: unlimited tools, all jurisdictions, alerts. Enterprise $199/mo: API access, audit reports, team seats.
forgeLabs.confidence: High — validated by Guidehouse data showing governance is THE gap, and FORGE already has the scanner infrastructure

articles.title: Survey: Nearly 50% of Hospitals Aren't Ready to Implement AI
articles.takeaway: 78% of health systems are in AI projects but only 52% feel operationally ready. Gap = data quality, governance, cybersecurity, staff alignment. Exactly the 'pilot purgatory' FORGE solves.
articles.linkedInAngle: The readiness gap IS the opportunity. Hospitals don't need more AI tools — they need an activation bridge from pilot to production. This is why runtime governance matters.

articles.title: The AI Wild West Is Over: Why 2026 Is the Year Health Systems Must Take Control
articles.takeaway: 71% of US hospitals now have some AI in daily ops. But fragmented data, siloed pilots, and limited governance create risk. The shift from experimentation to enterprise discipline is happening NOW.
articles.linkedInAngle: The 'wild west' framing is powerful — health systems moving from AI experimentation to disciplined, governed deployment. FORGE's positioning as the governance/activation layer is perfectly timed.

articles.title: Health Systems Seek AI as a Growth Driver in 2026
articles.takeaway: CIOs stepping away from AI experimentation toward disciplined approaches focused on reliability, scalability, and enterprise-wide value. Build once, deploy across the enterprise.
articles.linkedInAngle: CIOs are done with pilot-itis. They want 'build once, deploy everywhere.' That requires runtime governance at the API layer — exactly what LUMEN SDK enables.

linkedInPulse.note: Search returned synthesized trends rather than specific posts. Key signal: Healthcare AI governance is THE conversation on LinkedIn right now — URAC accreditation, CHAI frameworks, and the Guidehouse readiness gap are generating significant discussion among health IT leaders.

video.title: Clinical AI Governance: What Clinicians Must Know in 2026
video.note: Features oncology and health policy leaders discussing risks of AI adoption without governance frameworks. Directly validates FORGE's thesis.

mindset.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now. — Chinese Proverb
mindset.reflection: 78% of hospitals are in AI projects but only half are ready. That gap isn't a problem — it's a 20-year healthcare career meeting the perfect moment. You built the scanner. You built the SDK. The market is literally saying 'we need governance.' Ship PolicyPulse this week.
